Simulate Data for Inference

Source: R/model_simulation.R
data_sim_for_inference.Rd

This function generates a simulated dataset for inference, based on the specified model and parameters. It can include optional features such as monthly aggregation, unequal days in months, and adding noise to the simulated data.

Usage

data_sim_for_inference(
  model,
  param_inputs,
  dates,
  noise = FALSE,
  month = FALSE,
  month_unequal_days = FALSE
)

Arguments

model

The model to use for simulation. This should be a valid model object that data_sim can process.

param_inputs

A list or vector of parameters required by the model for simulation.

dates

A vector of two dates (start_date and end_date) specifying the time range for the simulation.

noise

Logical. If TRUE, random noise is added to the simulated incidence data using a negative binomial distribution.

month

Logical. If TRUE, incidence data is aggregated by month. Defaults to FALSE.

month_unequal_days

Logical. If TRUE, the function accounts for months with unequal days in the simulation. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

A data frame containing simulated incidence data, formatted according to the output of data_sim. If noise is enabled, the inc column will include added noise.

Details

  • When month = TRUE, the simulation aggregates incidence by month, and the month_unequal_days parameter can control whether or not to adjust for months with different numbers of days.

  • If noise = TRUE, a negative binomial distribution is used to add random noise to the incidence values. The size parameter for the negative binomial distribution is fixed at 100.

See also

  • data_sim: The underlying function used for simulation.

Examples

# Example usage
model <- some_model_object
#> Error: object 'some_model_object' not found
param_inputs <- list(beta = 0.3, gamma = 0.1)
dates <- c("2022-01-01", "2022-12-31")

# Simulate data with no noise, not aggregated by month
sim_data <- data_sim_for_inference(model, param_inputs, dates, noise = FALSE, month = FALSE)
#> Error: object 'model' not found

# Simulate data with noise, aggregated by month
sim_data_with_noise <- data_sim_for_inference(model, param_inputs, dates, noise = TRUE, month = TRUE)
#> Error: object 'model' not found
